message:
Following what I wrote here 👆 this morning on the subject of consciousness, the IDF publishes its response to the downing of the Israeli drone:

In response to Hezbollah firing a surface-to-air missile at an IDF UAV that was operating in Lebanese airspace yesterday (Saturday), IAF fighter jets struck a military compound used by the Hezbollah terrorist organization in the area of Beqaa in Lebanon. 

Moreover, IAF fighter jets struck an additional Hezbollah military structure in the area of Bint Jbeil and command centers in the areas of Qana and Baraachit in southern Lebanon overnight.

##
Complex, building and headquarters + black and white videos....

I don't know what they attacked, but the results presented here, in this manner, by the IDF spokesperson, do not communicate consequences and do not convincingly deter.
The New York police against more "keffiyehs" yesterday in Brooklyn.

Iceland, not only a land of volcanic eruptions:
The police spare no tear gas to disperse an anti-Israel demonstration yesterday in the capital Reykjavik.
Italy: Rome police officers are forced to use tear gas to hold back a violent anti-Israel demonstration.

At the University of Chicago, the local police officers had to deal with the keffiyehs who shout at them:
Shame on you
Shame on you

Columbia University in New York:
With the warm support of the Supreme Leader of Iran and Nasrallah, the tent camp was re-established, this time it was called the "Revolution Camp for Rafah".

The woman in the attached video, who opposes the activity, shouts at Hamas supporters in the "Rafah Camp":
Rapists... I hope you get raped...
The former president of Iran, Mahmoud Ahmadinejad, submitted his candidacy for the Iranian presidential elections this morning.

The Arab preoccupation with the photo of the body published last night by the military wing of Hamas continues.

The prevailing claim on social media is that the body presented by the military wing of Hamas, allegedly of a "kidnapped soldier", is that of an Arab mercenary.

In the attached tweet, which was seen by 1.2 million people in less than a day, the discussion about the origin of the mercenary in the hands of Hamas was discussed.
The leading options in the comments:
Egyptian
Saudi
Moroccan
Palestinian
Emirati
Jabaliya refugee camp in the north of the Gaza Strip: Gazans are cleaning their houses after the IDF forces left - they want to go back to living there.

Nablus: A Palestinian officer was killed in a ramming

Sources associated with Fatah claim that Ahmed and Mustafa Hamdan, brothers who live in Nablus, ran over Ra'ad Hakim, an officer in the Palestinian security apparatus, to death last night, because it was revealed that in the past that they had sold land to Jews.

These sources claim: the Palestinian officer who was run over to death was previously arrested by Israel "and was warned not to harm collaborators".
The president of Belarus, Lukashenko, a close ally of Putin, prepares for winter and chops firewood with a locally made ax, which he praises but adds, it could be better.
The Shiite militias in Iraq accepted responsibility for launching a UAV towards Eilat early in the morning.

It is important to note that from the consciousness aspect that Hezbollah is proud, and rightfully so, of shooting down a "prestigious" Israeli Hermes 900 type UAV - a clear achievement, easy to explain and market to the outside world.
On the other hand, the IDF explains that "significant assets were attacked" - a vague description that may actually be worth more than the downing of the Hermes but is very far from the psychological effect achieved by the downing of the UAV.
The public in Israel and those who oppose Hezbollah wants to know how Hezbollah "paid" for the their actions. This is also important for the Lebanese domestic audience in terms of deterrence. The IDF does not present its achievements on the Lebanese side in a clear way, compared to Hezbollah which makes excuses for every attack it carries out and makes sure to document it well and edit its videos as first class marketing material.

In the early morning, Lebanese channels reported on another Israeli attack, this time in Bint Jabil in southern Lebanon, which they described as "violent".

At the same time, despite the many attacks by the IDF throught the day yesterday, no deaths were recorded on the Lebanese side - only wounded. The last death in Lebanon was as a result of an attack on Friday.

Documentation of last nights attacks in Baalbek.

In addition, Lebanese media report on a series of attacks by the IDF in southern Lebanon.

Senior Hamas official Osama Hamdan summarizes Hamas's position on Biden's proposal for a deal:

President Biden's call to reach a deal is a positive thing, but an agreement cannot be reached only on the basis of wishful thinking.
We need a clear formulation that will express what we want and what we said. We want the Israeli side to accept this in a public and honest manner and not in a way that would allow it to evade the obligation.

We want a full ceasefire, withdrawal of Israeli forces from the Strip, aid and rehabilitation.

The Palestinian Ministry of Interior is the one that managed the Rafah crossing before the war and it is the one that will manage it after the war.

Up to this moment we have not received a written version of the proposal.

##
As I wrote here yesterday after Biden's speech - I don't see a new breakthrough here. It gives the impression that there is a new marketing move here, but the fundamental differences that prevented reaching an agreement, earlier, remain. There is an attempt to wrap the disputes in a new vague branding in the hope that it will hold water.
I suggest that Biden press for a new deal that talks about the day after - the elimination of Hamas and its disarmament. This would make it possible to end the war now. He should focus there. Hamas is trying to maintain its rule in the Strip. This is the heart of the matter. The kidnapping is only a means and not an end for Hamas.
